Codeunit TST Assert - NamedType IsTrueFailedMsg
Codeunit TST Assert - NamedType IsFalseFailedMsg
Codeunit TST Assert - NamedType AreEqualFailedMsg

trans-unit.source: Assert.AreNotEqual failed. Expected any Value except:<%1> (%2). Actual:<%3> (%4). %5.
trans-unit.note: Codeunit TST Assert - NamedType AreNotEqualFailedMsg

trans-unit.source: Assert.AreNearlyEqual failed. Expected a difference no greater than <%1> between expected Value <%2> and actual Value <%3>. %4
trans-unit.note: Codeunit TST Assert - NamedType AreNearlyEqualFailedMsg

trans-unit.source: Assert.AreNotNearlyEqual failed. Expected a difference greater than <%1> between expected Value <%2> and actual Value <%3>. %4
trans-unit.note: Codeunit TST Assert - NamedType AreNotNearlyEqualFailedMsg

trans-unit.source: Assert.RecordsAreEqualExceptCertainFields failed. Expected the records to match. Difference found in <%1>. Left Value <%2>, Right Value <%3>. %4
trans-unit.note: Codeunit TST Assert - NamedType RecordsAreEqualExceptCertainFieldsErr
Codeunit TST Assert - NamedType FailFailedMsg

trans-unit.source: Assert.TableIsEmpty failed. Table <%1> with filter <%2> must not contain records.
trans-unit.note: Codeunit TST Assert - NamedType TableIsEmptyErr

trans-unit.source: Assert.TableIsNotEmpty failed. Table <%1> with filter <%2> must contain records.
trans-unit.note: Codeunit TST Assert - NamedType TableIsNotEmptyErr
Codeunit TST Assert - NamedType KnownFailureMsg
Codeunit TST Assert - NamedType ExpectederrorFailed

trans-unit.source: Assert.ExpectederrorCode failed. Expected: %1. Actual: %2. Actual error message: %3.
trans-unit.note: Codeunit TST Assert - NamedType ExpectederrorCodeFailed
Codeunit TST Assert - NamedType ExpectedMessageFailedErr

trans-unit.source: Assert.RecordCount failed. Expected Number of %1 entries: %2. Actual: %3.
trans-unit.note: Codeunit TST Assert - NamedType RecordCountErr

trans-unit.source: Equality assertions only support Boolean, Option, Integer, BigInteger, Decimal, Code, Text, Date, DateFormula, Time, Duration, and DateTime Values. Current Value:%1.
trans-unit.note: Codeunit TST Assert - NamedType UnsupportedTypeErr
Codeunit TST Assert - NamedType RecordNotFounderrorCode
Codeunit TST Assert - NamedType RecordAlreadyExistserrorCode
Codeunit TST Assert - NamedType RecordNothingInsideFiltererrorCode
Codeunit TST Assert - NamedType AsserterrorMsg
Codeunit TST Assert - NamedType PrimRecordNotFounderrorCode
Codeunit TST Assert - NamedType NoFiltererrorCode

trans-unit.source: The error has not been thrown.
trans-unit.note: Codeunit TST Assert - NamedType errorHasNotBeenThrownErr

trans-unit.source: Assert.TextEndsWith failed. The text <%1> must end with <%2>
trans-unit.note: Codeunit TST Assert - NamedType TextEndsWithErr
Codeunit TST Assert - NamedType TextEndSubstringIsBlankErr

{Dependency=Match,"ProfileDescription_ORDERPROCESSOR"}
Page Some Role Center - Property Caption

trans-unit.source: Manage sales processes, view KPIs, and access your favorite items and customers.
trans-unit.note: Page Some Role Center - Action embedding - Property ToolTip
Page Some Role Center - Action SalesOrders - Property Caption

trans-unit.source: Record your agreements with customers to sell certain products on certain delivery and payment terms. Sales orders, unlike sales invoices, allow you to ship partially, deliver directly from your vendor to your customer, initiate warehouse handling, and print various customer-facing documents. Sales invoicing is integrated in the sales order process.
trans-unit.note: Page Some Role Center - Action SalesOrders - Property ToolTip
Page Some Role Center - Action SalesOrdersShptNotInv - Property Caption

trans-unit.source: View sales documents that are shipped but not yet invoiced.
trans-unit.note: Page Some Role Center - Action SalesOrdersShptNotInv - Property ToolTip
Page Some Role Center - Action SalesOrdersComplShtNotInv - Property Caption

trans-unit.source: View sales documents that are fully shipped but not fully invoiced.
trans-unit.note: Page Some Role Center - Action SalesOrdersComplShtNotInv - Property ToolTip

trans-unit.source: Sales Orders - Microsoft Dynamics 365 for Sales
trans-unit.note: Page Some Role Center - Action Sales Orders - Microsoft Dynamics 365 for Sales - Property Caption

trans-unit.source: View sales orders in Dynamics 365 for Sales that are coupled with sales orders in Business Central.
trans-unit.note: Page Some Role Center - Action Sales Orders - Microsoft Dynamics 365 for Sales - Property ToolTip
Page Some Role Center - Action Sales Quotes - Property Caption

trans-unit.source: Make offers to customers to sell certain products on certain delivery and payment terms. While you negotiate with a customer, you can change and resend the sales quote as much as needed. When the customer accepts the offer, you convert the sales quote to a sales invoice or a sales order in which you process the sale.
trans-unit.note: Page Some Role Center - Action Sales Quotes - Property ToolTip
Page Some Role Center - Action Blanket Sales Orders - Property Caption

trans-unit.source: Use blanket sales orders as a framework for a long-term agreement between you and your customers to sell large quantities that are to be delivered in several smaller shipments over a certain period of time. Blanket orders often cover only one item with predetermined delivery dates. The main reason for using a blanket order rather than a sales order is that quantities entered on a blanket order do not affect item availability and thus can be used as a worksheet for monitoring, forecasting, and planning purposes..
trans-unit.note: Page Some Role Center - Action Blanket Sales Orders - Property ToolTip
Page Some Role Center - Action Sales Invoices - Property Caption

trans-unit.source: Register your sales to customers and invite them to pay according to the delivery and payment terms by sending them a sales invoice document. Posting a sales invoice registers shipment and records an open receivable entry on the customer's account, which will be closed when payment is received. To manage the shipment process, use sales orders, in which sales invoicing is integrated.
trans-unit.note: Page Some Role Center - Action Sales Invoices - Property ToolTip
Page Some Role Center - Action Sales Credit Memos - Property Caption

trans-unit.source: Revert the financial transactions involved when your customers want to cancel a purchase or return incorrect or damaged items that you sent to them and received payment for. To include the correct information, you can create the sales credit memo from the related posted sales invoice or you can create a new sales credit memo with copied invoice information. If you need more control of the sales return process, such as warehouse documents for the physical handling, use sales return orders, in which sales credit memos are integrated. Note: If an erroneous sale has not been paid yet, you can simply cancel the posted sales invoice to automatically revert the financial transaction.
trans-unit.note: Page Some Role Center - Action Sales Credit Memos - Property ToolTip
Page Some Role Center - Action Sales Return Orders - Property Caption

trans-unit.source: Compensate your customers for incorrect or damaged items that you sent to them and received payment for. Sales return orders enable you to receive items from multiple sales documents with one sales return, automatically create related sales credit memos or other return-related documents, such as a replacement sales order, and support warehouse documents for the item handling. Note: If an erroneous sale has not been paid yet, you can simply cancel the posted sales invoice to automatically revert the financial transaction.
trans-unit.note: Page Some Role Center - Action Sales Return Orders - Property ToolTip
Page Some Role Center - Action Items - Property Caption

trans-unit.source: View or edit detailed information for the products that you trade in. The item card can be of type Inventory or Service to specify if the item is a physical unit or a labor time unit. Here you also define if items in inventory or on incoming orders are automatically reserved for outbound documents and whether order tracking links are created between demand and supply to reflect planning actions.
trans-unit.note: Page Some Role Center - Action Items - Property ToolTip
Page Some Role Center - Action Customers - Property Caption

trans-unit.source: View or edit detailed information for the customers that you trade with. From each customer card, you can open related information, such as sales statistics and ongoing orders, and you can define special prices and line discounts that you grant if certain conditions are met.
trans-unit.note: Page Some Role Center - Action Customers - Property ToolTip
Page Some Role Center - Action Item Journals - Property Caption

trans-unit.source: Post item transactions directly to the item ledger to adjust inventory in connection with purchases, sales, and positive or negative adjustments without using documents. You can save sets of item journal lines as standard journals so that you can perform recurring postings quickly. A condensed version of the item journal function exists on item cards for quick adjustment of an items inventory quantity.
trans-unit.note: Page Some Role Center - Action Item Journals - Property ToolTip
Page Some Role Center - Action SalesJournals - Property Caption

trans-unit.source: Post any sales-related transaction directly to a customer, bank, or general ledger account instead of using dedicated documents. You can post all types of financial sales transactions, including payments, refunds, and finance charge amounts. Note that you cannot post item quantities with a sales journal.
trans-unit.note: Page Some Role Center - Action SalesJournals - Property ToolTip
Page Some Role Center - Action CashReceiptJournals - Property Caption

trans-unit.source: Register received payments by manually applying them to the related customer, vendor, or bank ledger entries. Then, post the payments to G/L accounts and thereby close the related ledger entries.
trans-unit.note: Page Some Role Center - Action CashReceiptJournals - Property ToolTip
Page Some Role Center - Action Transfer Orders - Property Caption

trans-unit.source: Move inventory items between company locations. With transfer orders, you ship the outbound transfer from one location and receive the inbound transfer at the other location. This allows you to manage the involved warehouse activities and provides more certainty that inventory quantities are updated correctly.
trans-unit.note: Page Some Role Center - Action Transfer Orders - Property ToolTip
Page Some Role Center - Action Sales - Property Caption

trans-unit.source: Make quotes, orders, and credit memos to customers. Manage customers and view transaction history.
trans-unit.note: Page Some Role Center - Action Sales - Property ToolTip
Page Some Role Center - Action Action61 - Property Caption

trans-unit.source: View or edit detailed information for the customers that you trade with. From each customer card, you can open related information, such as sales statistics and ongoing orders, and you can define special prices and line discounts that you grant if certain conditions are met.
trans-unit.note: Page Some Role Center - Action Action61 - Property ToolTip
Page Some Role Center - Action Action74 - Property Caption

trans-unit.source: Make offers to customers to sell certain products on certain delivery and payment terms. While you negotiate with a customer, you can change and resend the sales quote as much as needed. When the customer accepts the offer, you convert the sales quote to a sales invoice or a sales order in which you process the sale.
trans-unit.note: Page Some Role Center - Action Action74 - Property ToolTip
Page Some Role Center - Action Sales Orders - Property Caption

trans-unit.source: Record your agreements with customers to sell certain products on certain delivery and payment terms. Sales orders, unlike sales invoices, allow you to ship partially, deliver directly from your vendor to your customer, initiate warehouse handling, and print various customer-facing documents. Sales invoicing is integrated in the sales order process.
trans-unit.note: Page Some Role Center - Action Sales Orders - Property ToolTip
Page Some Role Center - Action Action69 - Property Caption

trans-unit.source: Use blanket sales orders as a framework for a long-term agreement between you and your customers to sell large quantities that are to be delivered in several smaller shipments over a certain period of time. Blanket orders often cover only one item with predetermined delivery dates. The main reason for using a blanket order rather than a sales order is that quantities entered on a blanket order do not affect item availability and thus can be used as a worksheet for monitoring, forecasting, and planning purposes..
trans-unit.note: Page Some Role Center - Action Action69 - Property ToolTip
Page Some Role Center - Action Action72 - Property Caption

trans-unit.source: Register your sales to customers and invite them to pay according to the delivery and payment terms by sending them a sales invoice document. Posting a sales invoice registers shipment and records an open receivable entry on the customer's account, which will be closed when payment is received. To manage the shipment process, use sales orders, in which sales invoicing is integrated.
trans-unit.note: Page Some Role Center - Action Action72 - Property ToolTip
Page Some Role Center - Action Action70 - Property Caption

trans-unit.source: Compensate your customers for incorrect or damaged items that you sent to them and received payment for. Sales return orders enable you to receive items from multiple sales documents with one sales return, automatically create related sales credit memos or other return-related documents, such as a replacement sales order, and support warehouse documents for the item handling. Note: If an erroneous sale has not been paid yet, you can simply cancel the posted sales invoice to automatically revert the financial transaction.
trans-unit.note: Page Some Role Center - Action Action70 - Property ToolTip
Page Some Role Center - Action Action71 - Property Caption

trans-unit.source: Revert the financial transactions involved when your customers want to cancel a purchase or return incorrect or damaged items that you sent to them and received payment for. To include the correct information, you can create the sales credit memo from the related posted sales invoice or you can create a new sales credit memo with copied invoice information. If you need more control of the sales return process, such as warehouse documents for the physical handling, use sales return orders, in which sales credit memos are integrated. Note: If an erroneous sale has not been paid yet, you can simply cancel the posted sales invoice to automatically revert the financial transaction.
trans-unit.note: Page Some Role Center - Action Action71 - Property ToolTip
Page Some Role Center - Action Sales Journals - Property Caption

trans-unit.source: Post any sales-related transaction directly to a customer, bank, or general ledger account instead of using dedicated documents. You can post all types of financial sales transactions, including payments, refunds, and finance charge amounts. Note that you cannot post item quantities with a sales journal.
trans-unit.note: Page Some Role Center - Action Sales Journals - Property ToolTip
Page Some Role Center - Action Posted Sales Invoices - Property Caption

trans-unit.source: Open the list of posted sales invoices.
trans-unit.note: Page Some Role Center - Action Posted Sales Invoices - Property ToolTip
Page Some Role Center - Action Posted Sales Credit Memos - Property Caption

trans-unit.source: Open the list of posted sales credit memos.
trans-unit.note: Page Some Role Center - Action Posted Sales Credit Memos - Property ToolTip
Page Some Role Center - Action Posted Sales Return Receipts - Property Caption

trans-unit.source: Open the list of posted sales return receipts.
trans-unit.note: Page Some Role Center - Action Posted Sales Return Receipts - Property ToolTip
Page Some Role Center - Action Posted Sales Shipments - Property Caption

trans-unit.source: Open the list of posted sales shipments.
trans-unit.note: Page Some Role Center - Action Posted Sales Shipments - Property ToolTip
Page Some Role Center - Action Action68 - Property Caption

trans-unit.source: Move inventory items between company locations. With transfer orders, you ship the outbound transfer from one location and receive the inbound transfer at the other location. This allows you to manage the involved warehouse activities and provides more certainty that inventory quantities are updated correctly.
trans-unit.note: Page Some Role Center - Action Action68 - Property ToolTip
Page Some Role Center - Action Reminders - Property Caption

trans-unit.source: Remind customers about overdue amounts based on reminder terms and the related reminder levels. Each reminder level includes rules about when the reminder will be issued in relation to the invoice due date or the date of the previous reminder and whether interests are added. Reminders are integrated with finance charge memos, which are documents informing customers of interests or other money penalties for payment delays.
trans-unit.note: Page Some Role Center - Action Reminders - Property ToolTip
Page Some Role Center - Action Finance Charge Memos - Property Caption

trans-unit.source: Send finance charge memos to customers with delayed payments, typically following a reminder process. Finance charges are calculated automatically and added to the overdue amounts on the customer's account according to the specified finance charge terms and penalty/interest amounts.
trans-unit.note: Page Some Role Center - Action Finance Charge Memos - Property ToolTip
Page Some Role Center - Action Purchasing - Property Caption

trans-unit.source: View history for sales, shipments, and inventory.
trans-unit.note: Page Some Role Center - Action Purchasing - Property ToolTip
Page Some Role Center - Action Vendors - Property Caption

trans-unit.source: View or edit detailed information for the vendors that you trade with. From each vendor card, you can open related information, such as purchase statistics and ongoing orders, and you can define special prices and line discounts that the vendor grants you if certain conditions are met.
trans-unit.note: Page Some Role Center - Action Vendors - Property ToolTip
Page Some Role Center - Action Purchase Quotes - Property Caption

trans-unit.source: Create purchase quotes to represent your request for quotes from vendors. Quotes can be converted to purchase orders.
trans-unit.note: Page Some Role Center - Action Purchase Quotes - Property ToolTip
Page Some Role Center - Action Purchase Orders - Property Caption

trans-unit.source: Create purchase orders to mirror sales documents that vendors send to you. This enables you to record the cost of purchases and to track accounts payable. Posting purchase orders dynamically updates inventory levels so that you can minimize inventory costs and provide better customer service. Purchase orders allow partial receipts, unlike with purchase invoices, and enable drop shipment directly from your vendor to your customer. Purchase orders can be created automatically from PDF or image files from your vendors by using the Incoming Documents feature.
trans-unit.note: Page Some Role Center - Action Purchase Orders - Property ToolTip
Page Some Role Center - Action Blanket Purchase Orders - Property Caption

trans-unit.source: Use blanket purchase orders as a framework for a long-term agreement between you and your vendors to buy large quantities that are to be delivered in several smaller shipments over a certain period of time. Blanket orders often cover only one item with predetermined delivery dates. The main reason for using a blanket order rather than a purchase order is that quantities entered on a blanket order do not affect item availability and thus can be used as a worksheet for monitoring, forecasting, and planning purposes.
trans-unit.note: Page Some Role Center - Action Blanket Purchase Orders - Property ToolTip
Page Some Role Center - Action Purchase Invoices - Property Caption

trans-unit.source: Create purchase invoices to mirror sales documents that vendors send to you. This enables you to record the cost of purchases and to track accounts payable. Posting purchase invoices dynamically updates inventory levels so that you can minimize inventory costs and provide better customer service. Purchase invoices can be created automatically from PDF or image files from your vendors by using the Incoming Documents feature.
trans-unit.note: Page Some Role Center - Action Purchase Invoices - Property ToolTip
Page Some Role Center - Action Purchase Return Orders - Property Caption

trans-unit.source: Create purchase return orders to mirror sales return documents that vendors send to you for incorrect or damaged items that you have paid for and then returned to the vendor. Purchase return orders enable you to ship back items from multiple purchase documents with one purchase return and support warehouse documents for the item handling. Purchase return orders can be created automatically from PDF or image files from your vendors by using the Incoming Documents feature. Note: If you have not yet paid for an erroneous purchase, you can simply cancel the posted purchase invoice to automatically revert the financial transaction.
trans-unit.note: Page Some Role Center - Action Purchase Return Orders - Property ToolTip
Page Some Role Center - Action Purchase Credit Memos - Property Caption

trans-unit.source: Create purchase credit memos to mirror sales credit memos that vendors send to you for incorrect or damaged items that you have paid for and then returned to the vendor. If you need more control of the purchase return process, such as warehouse documents for the physical handling, use purchase return orders, in which purchase credit memos are integrated. Purchase credit memos can be created automatically from PDF or image files from your vendors by using the Incoming Documents feature. Note: If you have not yet paid for an erroneous purchase, you can simply cancel the posted purchase invoice to automatically revert the financial transaction.
trans-unit.note: Page Some Role Center - Action Purchase Credit Memos - Property ToolTip
Page Some Role Center - Action PurchaseJournals - Property Caption

trans-unit.source: Post any purchase-related transaction directly to a vendor, bank, or general ledger account instead of using dedicated documents. You can post all types of financial purchase transactions, including payments, refunds, and finance charge amounts. Note that you cannot post item quantities with a purchase journal.
trans-unit.note: Page Some Role Center - Action PurchaseJournals - Property ToolTip
Page Some Role Center - Action Posted Purchase Invoices - Property Caption

trans-unit.source: Opens a list of posted purchase invoices.
trans-unit.note: Page Some Role Center - Action Posted Purchase Invoices - Property ToolTip
Page Some Role Center - Action Posted Purchase Credit Memos - Property Caption

trans-unit.source: Opens a list of posted purchase credit memos.
trans-unit.note: Page Some Role Center - Action Posted Purchase Credit Memos - Property ToolTip
Page Some Role Center - Action Posted Purchase Return Shipments - Property Caption

trans-unit.source: Opens a list of posted purchase return shipments.
trans-unit.note: Page Some Role Center - Action Posted Purchase Return Shipments - Property ToolTip
Page Some Role Center - Action Posted Purchase Receipts - Property Caption

trans-unit.source: Open the list of posted purchase receipts.
trans-unit.note: Page Some Role Center - Action Posted Purchase Receipts - Property ToolTip
Page Some Role Center - Action Inventory - Property Caption

trans-unit.source: Manage physical or service-type items that you trade in by setting up item cards with rules for pricing, costing, planning, reservation, and tracking. Set up storage places or warehouses and how to transfer between such locations. Count, adjust, reclassify, or revalue inventory.
trans-unit.note: Page Some Role Center - Action Inventory - Property ToolTip
Page Some Role Center - Action Action93 - Property Caption

trans-unit.source: View or edit detailed information for the products that you trade in. The item card can be of type Inventory or Service to specify if the item is a physical unit or a labor time unit. Here you also define if items in inventory or on incoming orders are automatically reserved for outbound documents and whether order tracking links are created between demand and supply to reflect planning actions.
trans-unit.note: Page Some Role Center - Action Action93 - Property ToolTip
Page Some Role Center - Action Action96 - Property Caption

trans-unit.source: Post item transactions directly to the item ledger to adjust inventory in connection with purchases, sales, and positive or negative adjustments without using documents. You can save sets of item journal lines as standard journals so that you can perform recurring postings quickly. A condensed version of the item journal function exists on item cards for quick adjustment of an items inventory quantity.
trans-unit.note: Page Some Role Center - Action Action96 - Property ToolTip
Page Some Role Center - Action Item Charges - Property Caption

trans-unit.source: View or edit the codes for item charges that you can assign to purchase and sales transactions to include any added costs, such as freight, physical handling, and insurance that you incur when purchasing or selling items. This is important to ensure correct inventory valuation. For purchases, the landed cost of a purchased item consists of the vendor's purchase price and all additional direct item charges that can be assigned to individual receipts or return shipments. For sales, knowing the cost of shipping sold items can be as vital to your company as knowing the landed cost of purchased items.
trans-unit.note: Page Some Role Center - Action Item Charges - Property ToolTip
Page Some Role Center - Action Item Attributes - Property Caption

trans-unit.source: Assign item attribute values to your items to enable rich searching and sorting options. When customers inquire about an item, either in correspondence or in an integrated web shop, they can then ask or search according to characteristics, such as height and model year. You can also assign item attributes to item categories, which then apply to the items that use the item categories in question.
trans-unit.note: Page Some Role Center - Action Item Attributes - Property ToolTip
Page Some Role Center - Action Item Tracking - Property Caption

trans-unit.source: Assign serial numbers and lot numbers to any outbound or inbound document for quality assurance, recall actions, and to control expiration dates and warranties. Use the Item Tracing window to trace items with serial or lot numbers backwards and forward in their supply chain
trans-unit.note: Page Some Role Center - Action Item Tracking - Property ToolTip
Page Some Role Center - Action Item Reclassification Journals - Property Caption

trans-unit.source: Change information on item ledger entries, such as dimensions, location codes, bin codes, and serial or lot numbers.
trans-unit.note: Page Some Role Center - Action Item Reclassification Journals - Property ToolTip
Page Some Role Center - Action Phys. Inventory Journals - Property Caption

trans-unit.source: Select how you want to maintain an up-to-date record of your inventory at different locations.
trans-unit.note: Page Some Role Center - Action Phys. Inventory Journals - Property ToolTip
Page Some Role Center - Action Assembly Orders - Property Caption

trans-unit.source: Combine components in simple processes without the need of manufacturing functionality. Sell assembled items by building the item to order or by picking from stock.
trans-unit.note: Page Some Role Center - Action Assembly Orders - Property ToolTip
Page Some Role Center - Action Drop Shipments - Property Caption

trans-unit.source: Minimize delivery time and inventory cost by having items shipped from your vendor directly to your customer. This simply requires that you mark the sales order for drop shipment and then create a linked purchase order with the customer specified as the recipient.
trans-unit.note: Page Some Role Center - Action Drop Shipments - Property ToolTip
Page Some Role Center - Action Locations - Property Caption

trans-unit.source: Manage the different places or warehouses where you receive, process, or ship inventory to increase customer service and keep inventory costs low.
trans-unit.note: Page Some Role Center - Action Locations - Property ToolTip
Page Some Role Center - Action Posted Documents - Property Caption

trans-unit.source: View the posting history for sales, shipments, and inventory.
trans-unit.note: Page Some Role Center - Action Posted Documents - Property ToolTip
Page Some Role Center - Action Action32 - Property Caption

trans-unit.source: Open the list of posted sales invoices.
trans-unit.note: Page Some Role Center - Action Action32 - Property ToolTip
Page Some Role Center - Action Action34 - Property Caption

trans-unit.source: Open the list of posted sales credit memos.
trans-unit.note: Page Some Role Center - Action Action34 - Property ToolTip
Page Some Role Center - Action Posted Return Receipts - Property Caption

trans-unit.source: Open the list of posted return receipts.
trans-unit.note: Page Some Role Center - Action Posted Return Receipts - Property ToolTip
Page Some Role Center - Action Action40 - Property Caption

trans-unit.source: Open the list of posted sales shipments.
trans-unit.note: Page Some Role Center - Action Action40 - Property ToolTip
Page Some Role Center - Action Action54 - Property Caption

trans-unit.source: Open the list of posted purchase invoices.
trans-unit.note: Page Some Role Center - Action Action54 - Property ToolTip
Page Some Role Center - Action Action86 - Property Caption

trans-unit.source: Opens the list of posted purchase credit memos.
trans-unit.note: Page Some Role Center - Action Action86 - Property ToolTip
Page Some Role Center - Action Action87 - Property Caption

trans-unit.source: Opens the list of posted purchase return shipments.
trans-unit.note: Page Some Role Center - Action Action87 - Property ToolTip
Page Some Role Center - Action Action53 - Property Caption

trans-unit.source: Open the list of posted purchase receipts.
trans-unit.note: Page Some Role Center - Action Action53 - Property ToolTip
Page Some Role Center - Action Posted Transfer Shipments - Property Caption

trans-unit.source: Open the list of posted transfer shipments.
trans-unit.note: Page Some Role Center - Action Posted Transfer Shipments - Property ToolTip
Page Some Role Center - Action Posted Transfer Receipts - Property Caption

trans-unit.source: Open the list of posted transfer receipts.
trans-unit.note: Page Some Role Center - Action Posted Transfer Receipts - Property ToolTip
Page Some Role Center - Action Issued Reminders - Property Caption

trans-unit.source: Opens the list of issued reminders.
trans-unit.note: Page Some Role Center - Action Issued Reminders - Property ToolTip
Page Some Role Center - Action Issued Finance Charge Memos - Property Caption

trans-unit.source: Opens the list of issued finance charge memos.
trans-unit.note: Page Some Role Center - Action Issued Finance Charge Memos - Property ToolTip
Page Some Role Center - Action Self-Service - Property Caption

trans-unit.source: Manage your time sheets and assignments.
trans-unit.note: Page Some Role Center - Action Self-Service - Property ToolTip
Page Some Role Center - Action Time Sheets - Property Caption

trans-unit.source: Open the list of your resources' time sheets. Time sheets enable resources to register time. When approved, if approval is required, time sheet entries can be posted to the relevant job journal or resource journal as part of project progress reporting. To save setup time and to ensure data correctness, you can copy job planning lines into time sheets.
trans-unit.note: Page Some Role Center - Action Time Sheets - Property ToolTip
Page Some Role Center - Action Page Time Sheet List Open - Property Caption

trans-unit.source: Open the card for the selected record.
trans-unit.note: Page Some Role Center - Action Page Time Sheet List Open - Property ToolTip
Page Some Role Center - Action Page Time Sheet List Submitted - Property Caption

trans-unit.source: Open the list of submitted time sheets.
trans-unit.note: Page Some Role Center - Action Page Time Sheet List Submitted - Property ToolTip
Page Some Role Center - Action Page Time Sheet List Rejected - Property Caption

trans-unit.source: Open the list of rejected time sheets.
trans-unit.note: Page Some Role Center - Action Page Time Sheet List Rejected - Property ToolTip
Page Some Role Center - Action Page Time Sheet List Approved - Property Caption

trans-unit.source: Open the list of approved time sheets.
trans-unit.note: Page Some Role Center - Action Page Time Sheet List Approved - Property ToolTip
Page Some Role Center - Action User Tasks - Property Caption

trans-unit.source: Create tasks to remind you of work to be done. You can create tasks for yourself, but you can also assign tasks to others or be assigned a task by someone else in your organization.
trans-unit.note: Page Some Role Center - Action User Tasks - Property ToolTip
Page Some Role Center - Action Sales &Quote - Property Caption

trans-unit.source: Create a new sales quote to offer items or services to a customer.
trans-unit.note: Page Some Role Center - Action Sales &Quote - Property ToolTip
Page Some Role Center - Action Sales &Invoice - Property Caption

trans-unit.source: Create a new invoice for the sales of items or services. Invoice quantities cannot be posted partially.
trans-unit.note: Page Some Role Center - Action Sales &Invoice - Property ToolTip
Page Some Role Center - Action Sales &Order - Property Caption

trans-unit.source: Create a new sales order for items or services.
trans-unit.note: Page Some Role Center - Action Sales &Order - Property ToolTip
Page Some Role Center - Action Sales &Return Order - Property Caption

trans-unit.source: Compensate your customers for incorrect or damaged items that you sent to them and received payment for. Sales return orders enable you to receive items from multiple sales documents with one sales return, automatically create related sales credit memos or other return-related documents, such as a replacement sales order, and support warehouse documents for the item handling. Note: If an erroneous sale has not been paid yet, you can simply cancel the posted sales invoice to automatically revert the financial transaction.
trans-unit.note: Page Some Role Center - Action Sales &Return Order - Property ToolTip
Page Some Role Center - Action Sales &Credit Memo - Property Caption

trans-unit.source: Create a new sales credit memo to revert a posted sales invoice.
trans-unit.note: Page Some Role Center - Action Sales &Credit Memo - Property ToolTip
Page Some Role Center - Action Tasks - Property Caption
Page Some Role Center - Action Sales &Journal - Property Caption

trans-unit.source: Open a sales journal where you can batch post sales transactions to G/L, bank, customer, vendor and fixed assets accounts.
trans-unit.note: Page Some Role Center - Action Sales &Journal - Property ToolTip
Page Some Role Center - Action Sales Price &Worksheet - Property Caption

trans-unit.source: Manage sales prices for individual customers, for a group of customers, for all customers, or for a campaign.
trans-unit.note: Page Some Role Center - Action Sales Price &Worksheet - Property ToolTip
Page Some Role Center - Action ActionGroup42 - Property Caption
Page Some Role Center - Action &Prices - Property Caption

trans-unit.source: Set up different prices for items that you sell to the customer. An item price is automatically granted on invoice lines when the specified criteria are met, such as customer, quantity, or ending date.
trans-unit.note: Page Some Role Center - Action &Prices - Property ToolTip
Page Some Role Center - Action &Line Discounts - Property Caption

trans-unit.source: Set up different discounts for items that you sell to the customer. An item discount is automatically granted on invoice lines when the specified criteria are met, such as customer, quantity, or ending date.
trans-unit.note: Page Some Role Center - Action &Line Discounts - Property ToolTip
Page Some Role Center - Action Reports - Property Caption
Page Some Role Center - Action Customer - Property Caption
Page Some Role Center - Action Customer - &Order Summary - Property Caption

trans-unit.source: View the quantity not yet shipped for each customer in three periods of 30 days each, starting from a selected date. There are also columns with orders to be shipped before and after the three periods and a column with the total order detail for each customer. The report can be used to analyze a company's expected sales volume.
trans-unit.note: Page Some Role Center - Action Customer - &Order Summary - Property ToolTip
Page Some Role Center - Action Customer - &Top 10 List - Property Caption

trans-unit.source: View which customers purchase the most or owe the most in a selected period. Only customers that have either purchases during the period or a balance at the end of the period will be included.
trans-unit.note: Page Some Role Center - Action Customer - &Top 10 List - Property ToolTip
Page Some Role Center - Action Customer/&Item Sales - Property Caption

trans-unit.source: View a list of item sales for each customer during a selected time period. The report contains information on quantity, sales amount, profit, and possible discounts. It can be used, for example, to analyze a company's customer groups.
trans-unit.note: Page Some Role Center - Action Customer/&Item Sales - Property ToolTip
Page Some Role Center - Action ActionGroup31 - Property Caption
Page Some Role Center - Action Salesperson - Sales &Statistics - Property Caption

trans-unit.source: View amounts for sales, profit, invoice discount, and payment discount, as well as profit percentage, for each salesperson for a selected period. The report also shows the adjusted profit and adjusted profit percentage, which reflect any changes to the original costs of the items in the sales.
trans-unit.note: Page Some Role Center - Action Salesperson - Sales &Statistics - Property ToolTip
Page Some Role Center - Action Price &List - Property Caption

trans-unit.source: View a list of your items and their prices, for example, to send to customers. You can create the list for specific customers, campaigns, currencies, or other criteria.
trans-unit.note: Page Some Role Center - Action Price &List - Property ToolTip
Page Some Role Center - Action Inventory - Sales &Back Orders - Property Caption

trans-unit.source: View a list with the order lines whose shipment date has been exceeded. The following information is shown for the individual orders for each item: number, customer name, customer's telephone number, shipment date, order quantity and quantity on back order. The report also shows whether there are other items for the customer on back order.
trans-unit.note: Page Some Role Center - Action Inventory - Sales &Back Orders - Property ToolTip
Page Some Role Center - Action History - Property Caption
Page Some Role Center - Action Navi&gate - Property Caption

trans-unit.source: Find all entries and documents that exist for the document number and posting date on the selected entry or document.
trans-unit.note: Page Some Role Center - Action Navi&gate - Property ToolTip
